Title: Germany stays the course to replace nuclear power with more gas and LNG from next year
Description: The German government allowed three nuclear plants to continue operating until mid-April to ensure the country’s security of energy supply amid unprecedented gas shortages in the EU. But the phase-out of nuclear power and its replacement with gas remains the goal. This means Germany will use significantly more gas and LNG next year
Author: DE

Title: France launches gas barometer system to alert when demand cuts are necessary
Description: French gas transmission system operators GRTgaz and Terega launched a barometer system which alerts when consumption cuts are necessary because demand rises well above supply. The system indicates the balance between daily demand forecasts and supplies coming from pipelines, LNG terminals and storage. This is meant to encourage users to limit their consumption and so to avoid measures to force consumption cuts.
Author: DE

Title: LNG freight rates continue to soar as Europe holds onto ships for supply security
Description: LNG freight rates have soared to uncharted levels in the run-up to winter, as Europe’s scramble for LNG in its pivot away from Russian pipeline gas significantly tightened vessel and import slot availability in the Atlantic basin and across the European Union, respectively
Author: DE

Title: Nigeria LNG has no plans for now to halt operations despite force majeure
Description: Nigeria LNG said it expects to continue LNG production at its 22.2 mtpa LNG plant on Bonny Island, despite it having declared force majeure on LNG supplies on Oct. 17
Author: CK

Title: EU leaders ask EU Commission to further work on gas and LNG market intervention measures
Description: EU countries agreed that they need to accelerate efforts to reduce gas demand and ensure the security of supply, but failed to sign off the latest gas and LNG market intervention measures proposed by the European Commission. Instead they asked the commission to keep working on the measures, including a dynamic and temporary cap on TTF prices and an LNG benchmark
Author: DE

Title: Nigeria LNG ships two cargoes after FM declaration, more ships scheduled to arrive
Description: Nigeria LNG has shipped two LNG cargoes from the 22.2 mtpa LNG plant on Bonny Island since declaring force majeure on LNG supplies on Oct. 17 and it looks poised to load seven more cargoes by month-end, indicating that exports from the plant have not stopped.
Author: CK
